On 7 Aug 2025, at 10:05, Raneem Alsahhaf <RAlsahhaf@diriyah.sa <mailto:RAlsahhaf@diriyah.sa> > wrote:

		 

		Dear Nina,

		 

		Kindly find below answers highlighted in blue

		 

		*	What are the evacuation procedures?

			1.	Activate the audible and visual emergency alarm to alert everyone.
			2.	Guide attendees, by the Security and Safety Team, to the nearest emergency exits and then to the nearest designated assembly point associated with that exit.
			3.	Do not use elevators during the evacuation process.
			4.	Assemble at the pre designated safe assembly points.
			5.	Evacuation supervisors must ensure the building is completely cleared after everyone has existed.
			6.	Re-entry into the building is strictly prohibited until an official announcement declares the emergency has ended.

		 

		*	How many entry/exit points are there?

		1. Main entry and exit points: (2)

		2. Emergency exits for evacuation: (4)

		 

		*	How long would an evacuation take in the event of an emergency?

		The complete evacuation of the site is estimated to take between 2 to 5 minutes under ideal conditions.

		 

		*	Will first aid and/or ambulance facilities be available? If yes, please describe.

		Yes, the following support is available:

		On-site security personnel trained in basic first aid.

		Note: There is no ambulance or dedicated medical team available on-site.

		 

		*	What security or stewarding measures are in place?

		1. Manual inspection at all entry and exit points.

chunks.text:
On-site security personnel trained in basic first aid.

		Note: There is no ambulance or dedicated medical team available on-site.

		 

		*	What security or stewarding measures are in place?

		1. Manual inspection at all entry and exit points.

		2. Deployment of security personnel across the site according to a coverage plan that includes all critical areas.

		3. Surveillance cameras monitoring all entrances, exits, and sensitive zones.

		4. Presence of security and safety supervisors to coordinate efforts and ensure readiness.

		5. A pre-established security plan, including backup teams for emergency situations.

		 

		*	What is the estimated contract value for this event?

		My colleague @Rafeef Alobaid <mailto:RAlobaid@diriyah.sa>  will be able to assist you directly with the required details.

		 

		 

		Valet 

		*	We will bring our own external valet – confirming all cars will be dropped off at the entrance of the sales center? Yes, you can. Please share with us the Traffic and crowd management plan for your event when its ready starting from the entrance (how you want our security at the gate to identify your guests/ invitation card) to valet area and to car parking space. 
		*	On entering currently coffee is served in the reception area, will that be there during the event No they will not be there during the event as all the employees of the building will leave at 6 pm.
		*	As mentioned on site we may have VIP’s who would need to use the VIP entrance so let’s keep that in mind Yes, you can use the VIP entrance

					Hi Piya  

					 

					Please find below insurance requirements 

					 

					Please find the insurance requirements outlined below. Kindly ensure that the coverage limits for both policies are no less than SAR 2,000,000 :

					A) Public Liability:

					*	Include Diriyah Company as additional insured
					*	Add cross liability clause
					*	Waiver of subrogation clause
					*	1. Food and beverage poison liability
					*	2. Territory limits/cover and jurisdiction, including Saudi Arabia

					B) Workmen Compensation Insurance Policy: 

					*	Waiver of subrogation in favor of Diriyah Company

					 

					Regards 

					Bader 

					 

					Sent from my iPhone

					 

					On 16 Jul 2025, at 2:58 PM, Naif Alarouj <NAlarouj@diriyah.sa <mailto:NAlarouj@diriyah.sa> > wrote:

					﻿

					Dear @Piya Paul <mailto:piya@akanacollective.com> ,

					 

					Yes sure from 4-5 pm one from my colleagues will be with you in the site visit, from 6:30 to 7pm we will send someone from our contractor to be in the technical visit.

					 

					Regards,

					 

					<image001.png>

					<image004.png>

					    

					 

					Information Classification: Public

CAUTION: This email originated from outside of DGDA. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe. If you believe this email is malicious, please forward it toSOC@dgda.gov.sa <mailto:SOC@dgda.gov.sa>  . 

					 

					Hi Team,

					 

					Hope you are well, we would like to plan a site visit on Monday 28th or Tuesday, 29th of July.

					 

					As we are flying in for the site visit we would like to use the time wisely to plan the following walkthroughs – rough schedule below.

					 

					*	3:00 pm – 5:00 pm – Akana preliminary walk through
					*	4:00 pm – 5:00 pm - Initial walk through with your team and Chalhoub Team – 1 hour
					*	5:00 pm – 5:30 pm - Catering site visit – 30 minutes
					*	5:30 pm – 6:30 pm - Production site visit – 1 hour
					*	6:30 pm – 7:00 pm - AV Site visit – 1 hour (post sunset) – we would need the technical team from your venue to be present as well

					 

					Do let us know what day works better for you, thank you.

					 

					Best,

					Piya Paul 

					 

					Event Director 

					Mobile: +971 52 298 9827

					Akana Collective 

					www.akanacollective.com <https://url.uk.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/C-5nC51OGTn3KlDhyiKtkv78k?domain=urldefense.com> 

					<image017.png>

Thanks so much for the introduction.

					 

					Lovely to connect @Badr SAlmandeel <mailto:bsalmandeel@diriyah.sa>  as Ayah mentioned, we have a few questions about the Diriyah sales office.

					 

					Please find below:

					 

					*	Do you happen to have a video walkthrough of the space as well as photos (we have received the renders) 
					*	Could you share a pdf version of the floor plan as well as the CAD drawing?
					*	Would guests attending need a Diriyah ticket to access the sales center?
					*	If we intend to hire an external valet company is this possible ?

					*	Where would the drop off point be ?
					*	Do you have sufficient parking spots for the valet to use for a cocktail of 150 guests?
					*	Would there be an associated charge if we bring this in from outside?

					*	From the renders I can see you have lighting within the space

					*	Is this dimmable?

					*	Do you have existing furniture within the space? Cocktail Tables and lounges? Any pictures wold be greatly appreciated.
					*	Do you have an existing screen? (Can be seen in the renders  - outdoors)
					*	Do you have an existing sound speaker ?
					*	Do you have a pantry/ kitchen section that can be used for catering?
					*	If we were to have entertainment within the space would you require a permit?
					*	For set-up within the space – are there any fixed timings / permits?

					 

					Let us know if you have any questions, looking forward to your thoughts.

					 

					Thank you 

					 

					Best,

Kindly note that content updates may not be possible on Screen 3, which is the smaller screen located on the ground floor. Is there no way we can take this over as well? What will the content be for screen 3 ?

	 

	However, you will be able to update content on the remaining two screens. and please ensure sharing the screen content ahead of time for testing. Noted 

	 

	Attached are the screen size and resolution details: Well received – is there audio tied to these screens? As mentioned on the site visit we discussed using the audio for the history wall 

	*	Screen 1: Referred to as “GF History Wall – size and resolution”
	*	Screen 2: Referred to as “GF Master Plan LED Wall – size and resolution”
	*	If we’re able to update content on Screen 3, its size and resolution match that of Screen 2.

	 

	Additionally, please be aware that the audio system at the Sales Center is currently non-functional.  Is there any way to get this to work before the event as it’s in November?

	 

	If you plan to include audio during the event, you’ll need to bring your own equipment and gear.

	 

	Let me know if you need any further support.

	 

	Regards,

	 

	 

	<image002.png><image003.png>    

	 

	Information Classification: Public

On 7 Aug 2025, at 10:05, Raneem Alsahhaf <RAlsahhaf@diriyah.sa <mailto:RAlsahhaf@diriyah.sa> > wrote:

		 

		Dear Nina,

		 

		Kindly find below answers highlighted in blue

		 

		*	What are the evacuation procedures?

			1.	Activate the audible and visual emergency alarm to alert everyone.
			2.	Guide attendees, by the Security and Safety Team, to the nearest emergency exits and then to the nearest designated assembly point associated with that exit.
			3.	Do not use elevators during the evacuation process.
			4.	Assemble at the pre designated safe assembly points.
			5.	Evacuation supervisors must ensure the building is completely cleared after everyone has existed.
			6.	Re-entry into the building is strictly prohibited until an official announcement declares the emergency has ended.

		 

		*	How many entry/exit points are there?

		1. Main entry and exit points: (2)

		2. Emergency exits for evacuation: (4)

		 

		*	How long would an evacuation take in the event of an emergency?

		The complete evacuation of the site is estimated to take between 2 to 5 minutes under ideal conditions.

		 

		*	Will first aid and/or ambulance facilities be available? If yes, please describe.

		Yes, the following support is available:

		On-site security personnel trained in basic first aid.

		Note: There is no ambulance or dedicated medical team available on-site.

		 

		*	What security or stewarding measures are in place?

		1. Manual inspection at all entry and exit points.

On-site security personnel trained in basic first aid.

		Note: There is no ambulance or dedicated medical team available on-site.

		 

		*	What security or stewarding measures are in place?

		1. Manual inspection at all entry and exit points.

		2. Deployment of security personnel across the site according to a coverage plan that includes all critical areas.

		3. Surveillance cameras monitoring all entrances, exits, and sensitive zones.

		4. Presence of security and safety supervisors to coordinate efforts and ensure readiness.

		5. A pre-established security plan, including backup teams for emergency situations.

		 

		*	What is the estimated contract value for this event?

		My colleague @Rafeef Alobaid <mailto:RAlobaid@diriyah.sa>  will be able to assist you directly with the required details.

		 

		 

		Valet 

		*	We will bring our own external valet – confirming all cars will be dropped off at the entrance of the sales center? Yes, you can. Please share with us the Traffic and crowd management plan for your event when its ready starting from the entrance (how you want our security at the gate to identify your guests/ invitation card) to valet area and to car parking space.

		*	As mentioned on site we may have VIP’s who would need to use the VIP entrance so let’s keep that in mind Yes, you can use the VIP entrance 

		Hostess

					*	Do you happen to have staff that can be used to open the doors from the inside space to the outside? During the event, after 6 pm there will be no employees in the building, only the security at the external gate

					 

					Screens & interactive Room – Diriya

					*	As mentioned on site we would like to use all the screens inside the sales center to showcase the Chalhoub video – please confirm if this is possible with Diriya IT Team we will get back to you on this 
					*	We would also like to use the projectors in the Interactive room – please confirm if this is possible we will get back to you on this 
					*	Can you also confirm we can control the music inside the sales centre? We can shut the music off , but we cannot change the content. You can bring your audio system

					 

					AV Outside - Power 

					*	As discussed with AV on site we will need a generator for power outside – this will be managed by our team – please confirm how we get approval or permission for this as the generator will be stationed outside the sales centre send us the generator specification and we will get back to you on the permission needs.

					 

					Permit 

					*	Please share all permits required and documents needed – please let us know if there are any costs associated ot this (event permit, entertainment permit, catering permit, photo and video permit)

					Event Operational Plan

					Traffic Management Plan

					All Staff should have Valid Iqamas

					Furniture

					*	We will keep the outdoor lounge furniture as it is – do you happen to have more sets? Noted, we will keep the furniture as it is, but we cannot light the fire in the centre. We do not have more seats outdoor.

					 

					Security

Thanks so much for the introduction.

					 

					Lovely to connect @Badr SAlmandeel <mailto:bsalmandeel@diriyah.sa>  as Ayah mentioned, we have a few questions about the Diriyah sales office.

					 

					Please find below:

					 

					*	Do you happen to have a video walkthrough of the space as well as photos (we have received the renders) 
					*	Could you share a pdf version of the floor plan as well as the CAD drawing?
					*	Would guests attending need a Diriyah ticket to access the sales center?
					*	If we intend to hire an external valet company is this possible ?

					*	Where would the drop off point be ?
					*	Do you have sufficient parking spots for the valet to use for a cocktail of 150 guests?
					*	Would there be an associated charge if we bring this in from outside?

					*	From the renders I can see you have lighting within the space

					*	Is this dimmable?

					*	Do you have existing furniture within the space? Cocktail Tables and lounges? Any pictures wold be greatly appreciated.
					*	Do you have an existing screen? (Can be seen in the renders  - outdoors)
					*	Do you have an existing sound speaker ?
					*	Do you have a pantry/ kitchen section that can be used for catering?
					*	If we were to have entertainment within the space would you require a permit?
					*	For set-up within the space – are there any fixed timings / permits?

					 

					Let us know if you have any questions, looking forward to your thoughts.

					 

					Thank you 

					 

					Best,

					Piya Paul 

					 

					Event Director

chunks.text:
Kindly note that content updates may not be possible on Screen 3, which is the smaller screen located on the ground floor. Is there no way we can take this over as well? What will the content be for screen 3 ?

	 

	However, you will be able to update content on the remaining two screens. and please ensure sharing the screen content ahead of time for testing. Noted 

	 

	Attached are the screen size and resolution details: Well received – is there audio tied to these screens? As mentioned on the site visit we discussed using the audio for the history wall 

	*	Screen 1: Referred to as “GF History Wall – size and resolution”
	*	Screen 2: Referred to as “GF Master Plan LED Wall – size and resolution”
	*	If we’re able to update content on Screen 3, its size and resolution match that of Screen 2.

	 

	Additionally, please be aware that the audio system at the Sales Center is currently non-functional.  Is there any way to get this to work before the event as it’s in November?

	 

	If you plan to include audio during the event, you’ll need to bring your own equipment and gear.

	 

	Let me know if you need any further support.

	 

	Regards,

	 

	 

	<image002.png><image003.png>    

	 

	Information Classification: Public

On 7 Aug 2025, at 10:05, Raneem Alsahhaf <RAlsahhaf@diriyah.sa <mailto:RAlsahhaf@diriyah.sa> > wrote:

		 

		Dear Nina,

		 

		Kindly find below answers highlighted in blue

		 

		*	What are the evacuation procedures?

			1.	Activate the audible and visual emergency alarm to alert everyone.
			2.	Guide attendees, by the Security and Safety Team, to the nearest emergency exits and then to the nearest designated assembly point associated with that exit.
			3.	Do not use elevators during the evacuation process.
			4.	Assemble at the pre designated safe assembly points.
			5.	Evacuation supervisors must ensure the building is completely cleared after everyone has existed.
			6.	Re-entry into the building is strictly prohibited until an official announcement declares the emergency has ended.

		 

		*	How many entry/exit points are there?

		1. Main entry and exit points: (2)

		2. Emergency exits for evacuation: (4)

		 

		*	How long would an evacuation take in the event of an emergency?

		The complete evacuation of the site is estimated to take between 2 to 5 minutes under ideal conditions.

		 

		*	Will first aid and/or ambulance facilities be available? If yes, please describe.

		Yes, the following support is available:

		On-site security personnel trained in basic first aid.

		Note: There is no ambulance or dedicated medical team available on-site.

		 

		*	What security or stewarding measures are in place?

		1. Manual inspection at all entry and exit points.

On-site security personnel trained in basic first aid.

		Note: There is no ambulance or dedicated medical team available on-site.

		 

		*	What security or stewarding measures are in place?

		1. Manual inspection at all entry and exit points.

		2. Deployment of security personnel across the site according to a coverage plan that includes all critical areas.

		3. Surveillance cameras monitoring all entrances, exits, and sensitive zones.

		4. Presence of security and safety supervisors to coordinate efforts and ensure readiness.

		5. A pre-established security plan, including backup teams for emergency situations.

		 

		*	What is the estimated contract value for this event?

		My colleague @Rafeef Alobaid <mailto:RAlobaid@diriyah.sa>  will be able to assist you directly with the required details.

		 

		 

		Valet 

		*	We will bring our own external valet – confirming all cars will be dropped off at the entrance of the sales center? Yes, you can. Please share with us the Traffic and crowd management plan for your event when its ready starting from the entrance (how you want our security at the gate to identify your guests/ invitation card) to valet area and to car parking space.

		*	As mentioned on site we may have VIP’s who would need to use the VIP entrance so let’s keep that in mind Yes, you can use the VIP entrance 

		Hostess

					Event Operational Plan

					Traffic Management Plan

					Method of Statement

					Risk Assessment

					Filling out of all Permits (Gate Pass & Material) - Forms to be provided by DGCL

					List of Attendees

					Site Condition Survey (Event Agency should conduct a site survey prior to commencing any works)

					Site Handover Form - No work will commence before signing off the Handover Form (To be provided by DGCL)

					Kitchen Handover Form - DGCL to arrange proper HO of Kitchen

					All Staff should have Valid Iqamas

					All vehicles entering the premises should have Valid Insurance

					 

					Catering

					*	As mentioned on the site visit the team will send a list of what they need and don’t need in the kitchen Noted, there will be a condition survey and handover for the kitchen
					*	The bar area inside to be cleared for service of mocktails and the kitchen to be used for canapes prep Noted

					 

					Furniture

					*	We will keep the outdoor lounge furniture as it is – do you happen to have more sets? Noted, we will keep the furniture as it is, but we cannot light the fire in the centre. We do not have more seats outdoor.

					 

					Security

					*	Will you have security on site during the event only the security at the external gate

					 

					Cleaners

					Hi Team,

					 

					Hope you are well, we would like to plan a site visit on Monday 28th or Tuesday, 29th of July.

					 

					As we are flying in for the site visit we would like to use the time wisely to plan the following walkthroughs – rough schedule below.

					 

					*	3:00 pm – 5:00 pm – Akana preliminary walk through
					*	4:00 pm – 5:00 pm - Initial walk through with your team and Chalhoub Team – 1 hour
					*	5:00 pm – 5:30 pm - Catering site visit – 30 minutes
					*	5:30 pm – 6:30 pm - Production site visit – 1 hour
					*	6:30 pm – 7:00 pm - AV Site visit – 1 hour (post sunset) – we would need the technical team from your venue to be present as well

					 

					Do let us know what day works better for you, thank you.

					 

					Best,

					Piya Paul 

					 

					Event Director 

					Mobile: +971 52 298 9827

Thanks so much for the introduction.

					 

					Lovely to connect @Badr SAlmandeel <mailto:bsalmandeel@diriyah.sa>  as Ayah mentioned, we have a few questions about the Diriyah sales office.

					 

					Please find below:

					 

					*	Do you happen to have a video walkthrough of the space as well as photos (we have received the renders) 
					*	Could you share a pdf version of the floor plan as well as the CAD drawing?
					*	Would guests attending need a Diriyah ticket to access the sales center?
					*	If we intend to hire an external valet company is this possible ?

					*	Where would the drop off point be ?
					*	Do you have sufficient parking spots for the valet to use for a cocktail of 150 guests?
					*	Would there be an associated charge if we bring this in from outside?

					*	From the renders I can see you have lighting within the space

					*	Is this dimmable?

					*	Do you have existing furniture within the space? Cocktail Tables and lounges? Any pictures wold be greatly appreciated.
					*	Do you have an existing screen? (Can be seen in the renders  - outdoors)
					*	Do you have an existing sound speaker ?
					*	Do you have a pantry/ kitchen section that can be used for catering?
					*	If we were to have entertainment within the space would you require a permit?
					*	For set-up within the space – are there any fixed timings / permits?

					 

					Let us know if you have any questions, looking forward to your thoughts.

					 

					Thank you 

					 

					Best,

					Piya Paul 

					 

					Event Director

Kindly note that content updates may not be possible on Screen 3, which is the smaller screen located on the ground floor. Is there no way we can take this over as well? What will the content be for screen 3 ?

	 

	However, you will be able to update content on the remaining two screens. and please ensure sharing the screen content ahead of time for testing. Noted 

	 

	Attached are the screen size and resolution details: Well received – is there audio tied to these screens? As mentioned on the site visit we discussed using the audio for the history wall 

	*	Screen 1: Referred to as “GF History Wall – size and resolution”
	*	Screen 2: Referred to as “GF Master Plan LED Wall – size and resolution”
	*	If we’re able to update content on Screen 3, its size and resolution match that of Screen 2.

	 

	Additionally, please be aware that the audio system at the Sales Center is currently non-functional.  Is there any way to get this to work before the event as it’s in November?

	 

	If you plan to include audio during the event, you’ll need to bring your own equipment and gear.

	 

	Let me know if you need any further support.

	 

	Regards,

	 

	 

	<image002.png><image003.png>    

	 

	Information Classification: Public

chunks.text:
On 7 Aug 2025, at 10:05, Raneem Alsahhaf <RAlsahhaf@diriyah.sa <mailto:RAlsahhaf@diriyah.sa> > wrote:

		 

		Dear Nina,

		 

		Kindly find below answers highlighted in blue

		 

		*	What are the evacuation procedures?

			1.	Activate the audible and visual emergency alarm to alert everyone.
			2.	Guide attendees, by the Security and Safety Team, to the nearest emergency exits and then to the nearest designated assembly point associated with that exit.
			3.	Do not use elevators during the evacuation process.
			4.	Assemble at the pre designated safe assembly points.
			5.	Evacuation supervisors must ensure the building is completely cleared after everyone has existed.
			6.	Re-entry into the building is strictly prohibited until an official announcement declares the emergency has ended.

		 

		*	How many entry/exit points are there?

		1. Main entry and exit points: (2)

		2. Emergency exits for evacuation: (4)

		 

		*	How long would an evacuation take in the event of an emergency?

		The complete evacuation of the site is estimated to take between 2 to 5 minutes under ideal conditions.

		 

		*	Will first aid and/or ambulance facilities be available? If yes, please describe.

		Yes, the following support is available:

		On-site security personnel trained in basic first aid.

		Note: There is no ambulance or dedicated medical team available on-site.

		 

		*	What security or stewarding measures are in place?

		1. Manual inspection at all entry and exit points.

chunks.text:
On-site security personnel trained in basic first aid.

		Note: There is no ambulance or dedicated medical team available on-site.

		 

		*	What security or stewarding measures are in place?

		1. Manual inspection at all entry and exit points.

		2. Deployment of security personnel across the site according to a coverage plan that includes all critical areas.

		3. Surveillance cameras monitoring all entrances, exits, and sensitive zones.

		4. Presence of security and safety supervisors to coordinate efforts and ensure readiness.

		5. A pre-established security plan, including backup teams for emergency situations.

		 

		*	What is the estimated contract value for this event?

		My colleague @Rafeef Alobaid <mailto:RAlobaid@diriyah.sa>  will be able to assist you directly with the required details.

		 

		 

		Valet 

		*	We will bring our own external valet – confirming all cars will be dropped off at the entrance of the sales center? Yes, you can. Please share with us the Traffic and crowd management plan for your event when its ready starting from the entrance (how you want our security at the gate to identify your guests/ invitation card) to valet area and to car parking space. 
		*	On entering currently coffee is served in the reception area, will that be there during the event No they will not be there during the event as all the employees of the building will leave at 6 pm.
		*	As mentioned on site we may have VIP’s who would need to use the VIP entrance so let’s keep that in mind Yes, you can use the VIP entrance 

		Hostess
